org-entry.subsection: NATIONAL CHAMBERS OF COMMERCE AND AGRICULTURE

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Hungarian Chamber of Commerce and Industry

org-entry.content-note: central org. of the 23 Hungarian county chambers of commerce and industry
based on a system of voluntary membership

dir-section.heading: Regional Chambers of Commerce
dir-section.p: There are regional chambers of commerce in each of the 20 principal administrative divisions of Hungary (comprising the 19 counties and the City of Budapest). The following are among the most important:

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Borsod-Abaúj-Zemplén County Chamber of Commerce and Industry
Budapest Chamber of Industry and Commerce
Csongrád County Chamber of Commerce and Industry
Hajdú-Bihar County Chamber of Commerce and Industry
Pécs-Baranya Chamber of Commerce and Industry
Pest County Chamber of Commerce and Industry
Confederation of Hungarian Employers and Industrialists
National Asscn of Entrepreneurs and Employers

org-entry.content-note: safeguards interests of over 1,000 mem. enterprises (all private)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: National Federation of Agricultural Co-operators and Producers
org-entry-head.alt-name: Mezőgazdasági Szövetkezők és Termelők Országos Szövetsége

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Hungarian Energy and Public Utility Regulatory Authority

org-entry.content-note: regulation and supervision of activities performed by gas and electricity cos, price regulation and protection of consumer interest

subsidiary electicity supply cos incl. E.ON Del-dunántúli Áramszolgáltató (south-west Hungary), E.ON Észak-dunántúli Áramszolgáltató (north-west Hungary), E.ON Tiszántúli Áramszolgáltató (north-east Hungary)
53.3% owned by MVM Zrt. and 46.7% owned by Mátra Energy Holding Zrt.

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: MVM Hungarian Electricity Private Ltd Co
MVM Paks Nuclear Power Plant Ltd

org-entry.content-note: fmrly NKM Energy; present name adopted in 2020 following acquisition by MVM

the group comprises Agrikon Silo and Technical Works Ltd, Kecskemét and Budapest; Agrikon Cabin and Agrotechnical Works Ltd, Kiskunmajsa and Kiskőrös; Agrikon Metalindustrial Ltd, Kerekegyháza; and the foreign trade management company Agrikon SAM Ltd
engineering and servicing for agricultural and food-processing machines and storage facilities
manufacture of aluminium products and semi-products, truck bodies and automotive assemblies
property development and projects for commercial, residential and storage purposes
processing capacity of 20,000 metric tons, storage capacity of 18,000 tons, facility for daily production of 8,000 ready made meals
comprises plants in Nyíregyháza, Sárvár, Tab and Zalaegerszeg
engineering and manufacturing of household appliances
supplies natural gas to gas distribution companies, large industrial consumers and power plants in Hungary, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Romania and Croatia
retail and wholesale of household goods, photographic and optical equipment, appliances, cosmetics and pharmaceutical products
low-voltage switchgear and apparatus production for industrial use
represents and manages GE business interests in Hungary, including four manufacturing operations
subsidiary cos include Helm BioTec, Medimpex, Preglem
leading computer-aided design software developer for building design and architectural management
partly owned by CSK and Nippon Investment and Finance (Japan)
manufactures electrical components, spin dryers and washing machines
part of an online network for textiles and fashion
organizes trade fairs and exhibitions, provides advertising and direct marketing services, represents foreign trade fair companies
manufacture of agricultural equipment and vehicles
glass-lined and glass-enamelled processing equipment, steel constructions

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Masped First Hungarian General Forwarding Co

org-entry.content-note: international forwarding and carriage, custom services, warehousing, lo­gistic services
quality control and management, and inspection and laboratory testing

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: MOL Hungarian Oil and Gas PLC

org-entry.content-note: petroleum and gas exploration, processing, transportation and distribution
owned by Hungarian Power Companies Zrt. (Magyar Villamos Művek Részvénytársaság)
power plant investment, design and construction company

org-entry-head.alt-name: National Information and Commnunications Supplies Co

org-entry.content-note: business information office, economic research, information and marketing services, data processing, publishing
production of engines, transmissions and their parts
subsidiary of Opel (Germany), itself a subsidiary of Stellantis (Netherlands)
produces commercial vehicles, diesel engines, agricultural tractors, axles, self-propelled bus chassis

org-entry-head.alt-name: SEFAG Forestry and Timber Industry Co

org-entry.content-note: wood and wood products, hunting services
textiles, blankets, industrial wipes, geotextiles, materials for furnishings
renamed as above in 1995 following acquisition by Teva group
manufacture and trade in pharmaceutical products
50% owned by Peter Zwack & Consorten AG (Switzerland)
production and distribution of alcoholic beverages
